Sentencas: Single cells based on yttrium-doped SrTiO3 (YST) infiltrated porous YSZ anodes were investigated as an alternative material for sulfur and carbon tolerant solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: First, a YSZ electrolyte-based cell with porous YSZ as the support for electrode materials on both sides was prepared.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Then electrocatalyst materials were incorporated into the porous YSZ: the anode was infiltrated with YST precursor; and the cathode with LSM precursor to be heat treated in-situ.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Heat treatment under reducing conditions was found to successfully eliminate the yttrium titanate impurity and to markedly reduce the YST crystal size.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: The results showed that there was an optimum amount of infiltrated YST to balance the conductivity and the polarization.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: Furthermore, the maximum power density under dry hydrogen at 900 degrees C was found to be 95 mW cm(-2), which is greater than comparable reported values.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: H2S was found to have a promoting effect on the electrochemical performance of the fuel cell, particularly under methane.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3

Sentencas: This work suggests that the infiltration technique can be successfully used not only to eliminate the complications associated with high temperature treatments required in conventional YST-YSZ anodes, but also to improve the electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Electrochemical behavior of solid oxide fuel cell anodes based on infiltration of Y-doped SrTiO3
